com.example.vitabu

Class Book

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.example.vitabu.Book

  • public class Book
extends java.lang.Object
    The Book object for Vitabu that encapsulates all the possible attributes of a book

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Book()
      This is the empty default constructor that is necessary for Firebase Database.
      Book(java.lang.String title, java.lang.String author, java.lang.String ISBN, java.lang.String status, java.lang.String ownerName, java.lang.String description, java.lang.String borrower)
      This is the constructor that is used to instantiate the Book object with all the necessary regular parameters.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Book

        public Book(java.lang.String title,
            java.lang.String author,
            java.lang.String ISBN,
            java.lang.String status,
            java.lang.String ownerName,
            java.lang.String description,
            java.lang.String borrower)
        This is the constructor that is used to instantiate the Book object with all the necessary regular parameters.
        Parameters:
        title - the title of the book.
        author - the author of the book
        ISBN - the ISBN of the book
        status - the status of the book (borrowed, available, requested, accepted).
        ownerName - Username of the owner of the book.

      • Book

        public Book()
        This is the empty default constructor that is necessary for Firebase Database. We also use it when building up the class using the setters alone.

      • setStatus

        public void setStatus(java.lang.String status)
               throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Can only set the status to one of the following: requested, accepted, borrowed, or available. Any other value throws an error.
        Parameters:
        status - the value to which status needs to be set to.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException

      • getBorrower

        public java.lang.String getBorrower()
        Getter for borrower.
        Returns:
        Returns the username of the user currently borrowing (can be empty).
